summary: This is an FBI Crisis Intake document dated July 7, 2019, summarizing a call from a former 911 dispatcher regarding past calls from Jeffrey Epstein's residence to the Torrance County, NM dispatch. The caller reported that Epstein would answer callbacks and state police were not needed, and recalled a conversation with the former sheriff about the matter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose residence was the source of multiple 'open calls' (hang-ups) to 911 dispatch in Torrance County, NM. He would answer callbacks and tell dispatch it was not necessary to send police.

persons.name: Heath White
persons.context: The former sheriff of Torrance County, NM, who the caller spoke to in 2014 or 2015 about the past 911 calls from Epstein's residence. He reportedly told the caller 'everything would have been done already' regarding the calls.

connections.description: Sheriff White was informed about past 911 calls originating from Epstein's residence during the caller's tenure as a dispatcher.

events.title: 911 Calls from Epstein Residence
events.description: During the caller's tenure as a 911 dispatcher for Torrance County, NM, they received multiple 'open calls' (hang-ups) from Jeffrey Epstein's residence. Protocol required callbacks, and Epstein would often answer and state police were not needed.

events.title: Conversation with Former Sheriff
events.description: The former 911 dispatcher recalled talking to former Torrance County Sheriff Heath White about the past 911 calls from Epstein's residence. Sheriff White reportedly stated 'everything would have been done already' in response.

events.title: FBI Crisis Intake Call
events.description: A former 911 dispatcher called the FBI's National Threat Operations Center to report historical information regarding 911 calls from Jeffrey Epstein's residence in Torrance County, NM.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's residence (in Torrance County, NM)
keyFacts: A former 911 dispatcher for Torrance County, NM (2001-2005) reported receiving multiple 'open calls' (hang-ups) from Jeffrey Epstein's residence.
When dispatchers called back per protocol, Epstein would often answer and tell them it was not necessary to send police to his residence.
The former dispatcher recalled discussing these calls with then-Torrance County Sheriff Heath White in 2014 or 2015, who stated 'everything would have been done already' regarding them.
This information was reported to the FBI's National Threat Operations Center on July 7, 2019, after Epstein's arrest for child sex trafficking.
